title: Research Time Management
description:
Research Time Management 
 
 Research time management is an essential skill for academic success. In this workshop, participants will: 
 
 Learn the steps of the research process 
 Create a research timeline 
 Set SMART goals 
 Learn strategies to avoid procrastination 
 Learn about library "shortcuts" 
 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14525816

title: AAPI-Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Celebration
location: Addie's Lounge/CHSS Courtyard Lounge, University Hall
description:
The Graduate School invites you to an APPI Heritage Month event featuring: Dr. Sharon Lai on Navigating the AAPI Experience and How to do Origami workshop. This event is on Wednesday, May 14, from 3:30 - 5:00 pm at Addie's Lounge/CHSS Courtyard Lounge, University Hall.  
   
 Copy and Paste this link to register: https://graduate.montclair.edu/register/AsianPacificCelebration

title: MAT Initial Teaching Certification Virtual Information Session
description:
Our   Master of Arts in Teaching with Initial Certification Programs   offer pathways to certification so that you can lead classes and drive positive outcomes for students.  
 🏆 Our nationally and internationally recognized Teacher Education Program has many unique features, which include curricular emphasis, the  Center of Pedagogy , as well as partnerships with local schools and communities.    
 We're hosting a   virtual information session on May 14 at 5:00 PM.  This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals.

title: Getting Started with Mendeley
description:
Use   Mendeley  to organize your research: 
 
 Collect references as you browse the web or databases 
 Organize, highlight, and annotate your PDFs, all in one place 
 Sync between your devices 
 Generate citations instantly and change style formats with a few clicks 
 
 By the end of this workshop, you should be able to import your existing references into the program, collect references from the library databases, and be able to create in-text references and bibliographies with just a few clicks! 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14582368

title: Red Hawk Pantry
description:
Visiting the Pantry: 
 Please have your Event Pass, CWID and have a  PantrySoft Registration .  
 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Get certified in Mental Health First Aid!
description:
Register Here 
 Mental Health First Aid is an eight (8) hour course that teaches adults 18 years and older how to identify, understand and respond to signs of mental illnesses and substance use disorders. The training gives you the skills you need to reach out and provide initial help and support to someone who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem or experiencing a crisis. 
 Certification for Mental Health First Aid lasts for three (3) years. A certificate is available for download from the Mental Health First Aid Connect website upon completion of the training. 
 Multiple trainings will be offered in May and June: 
 Thursday, May 15th 
 Training is for one day, from 9:00am – 5:00pm. 
 Class size is limited to the first 30 who register. 
 Register Here 
 Please Note:  You must use your MSU email address to sign-up. You will receive an email inviting you to register on the Mental Health First Aid Connect website, and only after you do so, can be added to the course. Register as soon as possible to secure your seat.

title: Get certified in Mental Health First Aid!
description:

The training gives you the skills you need to reach out and provide initial help and support to someone who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem or experiencing a crisis.

 Multiple trainings will be offered in May and June: 
 Friday, May 16th 
 Training is for one day, from 9:00am – 5:00pm. 
 Class size is limited to the first 30 who register.

 Please Note:  You must use your MSU email address to sign-up. You will receive an email inviting you to register on the Mental Health First Aid Connect website, and only after you do so, can be added to the course. Register as soon as possible to secure your seat.

title: Counseling MA Virtual Information Session (All Concentrations)
description:
The world needs more counselors who lead with empathy, insight, and purpose - and if you're ready to take that next step, we're here to help you get there.  We're hosting a  virtual information session on May 19 at 4:00PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Addictions Counseling 
 Clinical Mental Health Counseling 
 School Counseling 
 Student Affairs/Higher Education

title: Fact-Checking And Misinformation
description:
This workshop will discuss the art of fact-checking sources. By learning to recognize bias, disinformation, and misinformation, you will gain the critical thinking skills vital for research and informed decision-making. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14525834

title: Child Advocacy and Policy (MA) & Child Advocacy (Certificate) Webinar
description:
If you're passionate about protecting children, influencing policy, and standing up for those who need it most, our graduate programs in child advocacy and policy are for you. We're hosting a  webinar on May 19 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Online Master of Arts in Child Advocacy and Policy 
 Child Advocacy (Certificate) – Online

title: Red Hawk Pantry
description:
Visiting the Pantry: 
 Please have your Event Pass, CWID and have a  PantrySoft Registration .  
 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Generate Ideas with Article Databases
description:
Not sure what to write about?  You can use article databases to come up with ideas.  Learn how to mine article databases such as Academic Search Complete, EBSCO Discovery Service, and ProQuest Central to generate new ideas, synthesis existing research, and identify research gaps.  Too many students begin with a narrow topic but then have a difficult time finding scholarly resources.  By searching the databases for what topics have already been researched, and by moving from broad topics to narrow ones, you can find something compelling and researchable to write about. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14582536

title: Discover Your Topic: Generate Ideas with Article Databases
description:
Not sure what to write about?  You can use article databases to come up with ideas.  Learn how to mine article databases such as Academic Search Complete, EBSCO Discovery Service, and ProQuest Central to generate new ideas, synthesis existing research, and identify research gaps.  Too many students begin with a narrow topic but then have a difficult time finding scholarly resources.  By searching the databases for what topics have already been researched, and by moving from broad topics to narrow ones, you can find something compelling and researchable to write about. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14582536

title: Higher Education MA Virtual Information Session
description:
Think you you belong in Higher Ed leadership? We can help you get there.  
 Whether you're already working in higher ed or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on  May 21 at 12:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues.

title: Annotated Bibliographies
description:
Learn about the different types of annotated bibliographies, what information is included in each type, and how to format your annotated bibliography. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14525954

title: MBA, Dual Degrees, & Graduate Certificates Virtual Information Session
description: Discover how earning an MBA from Montclair can significantly increase your career opportunities and earning potential. Our curriculum emphasizes leadership, strategy, and real-world application designed to equip ambitious professionals like you with the skills to thrive.  Registration is open for our  virtual information session May 29 at 9:30 AM (EST) . Join us to explore our expansive programs and find the best program to meet your professional goals.

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost - $40-$50 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturdays, 05/31 - 06/21 
 9 a.m. - 9:45 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center Pool

title: MSW Virtual Information Session
description:
Build a future that fuels your purpose   Our  MSW program  prepares you to support vulnerable children, teens, and families through both clinical practice and advocacy work. Whether you prefer to learn on campus or need the flexibility of our  new online option , we’ve got you covered. We're hosting a   virtual information session June 2 at 7:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 What you'll gain from the session 
 
 Direct point of contact with faculty leading the program 
 Career outlook and insight from industry experts in the field 
 In-depth preview of your future coursework and what makes our curriculum stand out 
 Advanced understanding of the intricacies of the current social work landscape 
 Free graduate application  - we'll waive the $60 application fee if you attend the session!

title: Wawayanda State Park Hike
description:
Come out for an advanced 5-mile hike in Wawayanda State Park. The Trail follows along a beautiful lake and is a great experience for advanced hikers looking to be immersed in nature. Enjoy a summer hike with streams, dams, and a historic iron furnace! 
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10; Faculty/Staff 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 June 6, 2025 
 10:00 am - 5:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring : Comfortable Shoes, Water, Lunch, and Appropriate Clothing. 
 Potential Hazards:  unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, insect bites, injury by running including sprains, lacerations, abrasions and fractures.

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340).

title: Child Advocacy and Policy (MA) & Child Advocacy (Certificate) Webinar
description:
Become a voice for those who need it most  If you're passionate about protecting children, influencing policy, and standing up for those who need it most, our graduate programs in child advocacy and policy are for you. We're hosting a  webinar on June 9 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Online Master of Arts in Child Advocacy and Policy 
 Child Advocacy (Certificate) – Online 
 
 What you'll gain from the session: 
 
 Direct point of contact with faculty leading the program 
 Career outlook and insight from industry experts in the field 
 In-depth preview of your future coursework and what makes our curriculum stand out  
 Advanced understanding of the intricacies of the public child welfare system

 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided, however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Evaluating Sources
description:
Join our workshop to learn the art of evaluating sources. Learn to discern credible sources, spot bias, and assess relevance. Gain critical thinking skills vital for academic success and informed decision-making. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Introduction to Research by Drew Wallace 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14623996

title: Gathering Your Sources: How to Use Library Resources to Find the Information You Need
description:
This workshop will highlight how to access different kinds of information through the Montclair State University Libraries, including books, newspaper articles, and scholarly publications. Perfect for those new to library research in a university setting. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14624021

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost - $40-$50 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturdays, 05/31 - 06/21 
 9 a.m. - 9:45 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center Pool

description:
Learn about the different types of annotated bibliographies, what information is included in each type, and how to format your annotated bibliography.

 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Higher Education MA Virtual Information Session
description:
Become a leader in Higher Education   
 Whether you're already working in higher ed or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on June 18  at 12:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues. 
 What you'll gain from the session: 
 
 Direct point of contact with faculty leading the program 
 Career outlook and insight from industry experts in the field 
 In-depth preview of your future coursework and what makes our curriculum stand out 
 Advanced understanding of the intricacies of the current higher ed landscape 
 Free graduate application  - we'll waive the $60 application fee if you attend the session!

title: MBA, Dual Degrees, & Graduate Certificates Virtual Information Session
description: Earning your MBA at Montclair is more than a credential—it’s a career accelerator. Our program is built to help you lead confidently, think critically, and solve complex business challenges. You’ll gain practical experience, strategic insight, and the professional network to move your career forward—on your terms.  Registration is open for our  virtual information session June 23 at 12:00 PM (EST) . Join us to explore our expansive programs and find the best program to meet your professional goals.

 Summer 2025 Hours-

 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Master of Public Health (MPH) Virtual Information Session
description:
Protect Communities. Promote Health. Lead Change.   
 Our Master of Public Health programs position graduates to work toward advancing the collective strength of populations. We offer two concentrations:  
 
 Public Health (MPH), Community Health Education Concentration 
 Public Health (MPH), Health Systems Administration and Policy 
 
 Register for our virtual information session June 24 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. Graduates of our program are prepared for careers as practitioners and leaders in a diverse array of public health settings including: 
 
 local and state government 
 public and private health agencies 
 voluntary and community-based organizations 
 schools 
 healthcare institutions 
 policy and advocacy organizations

title: Library 101
description:
Welcome to the Montclair State University Libraries! This workshop will give you an introduction to the university library, including: 
 
 Introduction to scholarly sources 
 Library collections (including books, multimedia, and databases) 
 Finding full text articles 
 How to get research assistance 
 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Library 101 by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/calendar/workshops/sprague234

title: Discover Your Topic: Tools and Strategies to Help You Find the Perfect Research Topic
description:
Identifying and developing a topic is one of the most important parts of the research process. Join us to learn how to use the resources at the Montclair State University Libraries to build the foundation for an exciting research project. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/calendar/workshops/sprague345

title: Summer Mystery Take-and-Make Crafts Are Here!
description: Unwind with our  Mystery Take-and-Make Craft Kits . Swing by the Drop-In Center to pick one up while supplies last. Mystery craft kit contains a different craft from our past events.
